itemDescription: 11th century founder of the Gilbertine Order

wikipedia_page.main: Gilbert of Sempringham (c. 1085 – 4 February 1190) the founder of the Gilbertine Order, was the only Medieval Englishman to found a conventual order, mainly because the Abbot of Cîteaux declined his request to assist him in organising a group of women who wanted to live as nuns, living with lay brothers and sisters, in 1148. He founded a double monastery of canons regular and nuns in spite of such a foundation being contrary to canonical practice.
